title: Light semiserif: Liquid Love
content:
Thought I might find this on dafont as it doesn't look too polished, but no luck. Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020202821im_/http:/typophile.com/files/liquid_5742.gif)
author: Bendy

comments.content:
I think it's called Ela... let me check.

- Lex

The closest I can think of right now is [MVB Bossa Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020202821/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mvb_fonts/mvb_bossa_nova/), although I swear I've seen this font before. I think the name starts with a V, although I'm sure that doesn't help. :P
Yeah, I thought it was Ela too...

To me it looks like a butchered [Adobe Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020202821/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond/) with some of the serifs sawn off, but maybe my eyes deceive me...

--- Tamas Ferencz ---
Really?! I'll see if I can get the same effect that way. But the strokes look inconsistent to me: the rounds are quite a bit heavier than the straights. And there doesn't seem to be any overshoot.

In some ways Storm's [Areplos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020202821/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/areplos/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D48%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DLIQUID%2520LOVE%2520PCT%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dsingle%26seed%3D21) is similar, but some of its serifs would need to be removed too. Tamas's theory bears consideration, but I haven't finished looking at semiserif fonts.

- Mike Yanega

Maybe that V font was [Vandermark](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020202821/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/vandermark/)? However, it's not a match.

- Mike Yanega

So far, Psy/Ops [Serus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020202821/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/psyops_type_foundry/serus_set_ot/?&sample_text=LIQUID%20LOVE%20PCT) is the closest I have found, but it's not exact.

- Mike Yanega
